title: blood
comment: The symbol of life, which thus plays an especially important role in the sacrificial system of the OT. The shedding of the blood of a sacrificial animal represents the giving up of its life. The ``blood of Christ'' refers to Jesus Christ's obedient giving of his life, in order to achieve redemption and forgiveness.

children.title: blood, as basis of life
children.comment: Scripture treats blood as the basis of life, and regards the shedding of blood as representing the end of life.

blood, and OT sacrifices
children.comment: The pouring out of animals' blood in sacrifice was God's provision, under the old covenant, for the atonement of sin.

blood, of Jesus Christ
children.comment: The shedding of the blood of Jesus Christ is seen as representing the giving of his life as an atoning sacrifice for the sins of humanity.

blood, as symbol of guilt
children.comment: Blood is often used as an image of people's sin and guilt, and the judgment which follows. Blood-guilt is ascribed to those who are responsible for the shedding of innocent blood.
